key_points: Governor Kathy Hochul and FEMA announce Nassau County's inclusion in the Major Disaster Declaration for Hurricane Ida relief.
Federal assistance extended includes both Individual and Public Assistance for several New York counties.
The assistance aims to support those recovering from the storm, including funds for housing, counseling, and legal services.
Governor Hochul thanks President Biden and FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell for their support.
Nassau County Executive Laura Curran highlights her efforts to secure disaster declaration and urges affected residents to apply for aid.
The Major Disaster Declaration facilitates financial help for local communities and individual New Yorkers.
New York State Division of Homeland Security and Emergency Services worked to assess damage and apply for federal aid.
Storm damages to public infrastructure and homes are estimated to be over $140 million, with 2,900 homes affected.
FEMA's Public Assistance Program will support the restoration of public infrastructure.
Governor Hochul ensures the allocation of $378 million in hazard mitigation funding from FEMA to strengthen state infrastructure against extreme weather.
